body_html:
Okay, that make sense, Indeed I had forgotten about side-effect nodes as I was mostly using value nodes.
But then, wouldn't it be possible to check if the node does have a side effect?
Then:
if it has a side effect: run it,
if it has no side effect: either if it has a value or tell user that it called run on an effect-less parameter?

The behavior:
"I'm tasked to do something"
"I do it silently" Is ok
but the behavior:
"I'm tasked with a useless task"
"I do nothing but silently" does not feel natural to me.

But I guess this behavior mainly depend on the complexity of determining "usefulness" of a node (as in value-returning or side-effect-ing)

body:
Okay, that make sense, Indeed I had forgotten about side-effect nodes as I was mostly using value nodes.
But then, wouldn't it be possible to check if the node does have a side effect?
Then:
if it has a side effect: run it,
if it has no side effect: either if it has a value or tell user that it called run on an effect-less parameter?

The behavior:
"I'm tasked to do something"
"I do it silently" Is ok
but the behavior:
"I'm tasked with a useless task"
"I do nothing but silently" does not feel natural to me.

But I guess this behavior mainly depend on the complexity of determining "**usefulness**" of a node (as in value-returning or side-effect-ing)
